lenders.name: George and Nancy
lenders.occupation: Nancy is a law clerk and George is a retired newspaper publisher, photographer and author.
lenders.loan_because: We believe that if everybody does a little bit to help others it all adds up to a lot! We think the Kiva concept is brilliant.
lenders.occupational_info:
As a retired journalist, George operated a bed and breakfast, is an author, and does freelance writing and photography. Nancy works for a law firm and specializes in real estate matters. George also has published two books about the now-closed Collingwood Shipyards. He used Blurb.com and information about the books, The Collingwood Shipyards, and A Salute to Sidelaunchings, can be found on that company's website. George has a website about those books and it is at www.collingwoodshipyardsbooks.vpweb.ca.
More recently, George published two more books: "Collingwood's Walk of History" which is about a waterfront area of this small town north of Toronto, Ontario, and the hiking/bicycling opportunities that exist. This book has 106 photographs as well as text. The other book is a very small book titled "Making Tracks and Changing". The first half of the book carries some of George's poetry written in the past 40 years or so. The second half of the booklet provides his perspective on how people can change their lives. George notes that he has no professional credentials to give advice, just "life experiences". All of George's books are available from the on-line bookstore at www.blurb.com.
